title: NativeFunctions: support backend-specific dispatch and SpatialRoIPooling
body_html:
This makes a number of changes to NativeFunctions, which are necessary to support SpatialRoIPooling. These are:

  1. Allow specifying backend-specific dispatch, e.g. CPU-vs-GPU functions dispatch to different native functions
  2. NativeFunctions now default/infer most arguments by parsing NativeFunctions.h. This is messy, but instead of having to provide ~10 lines of metadata per function, we usually require a single '// [NativeFunction]' specification
  3. NativeFunctions are split into declarations and definitions (e.g. CPU/all implementations in NativeFunctions.cpp, CUDA implementations in NativeFunctions.cu)

We also use these features to implement SpatialRoIPooling (courtesy of @killeent).

Nice to haves that aren't implemented:

  • Templated scalar type dispatch: this wasn't necessary for this PR
  • Generate NativeFunctions.h from a .yaml declaration. This would be a little clearer than parsing NativeFunctions.h directly.
